lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau cpl jl AMqr n dyKIAiq pUrnu pRgws pRiqibMb riv sis ko
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Chapal Jal Antar N Daykheeati , Pooranu Pragaas Pratibinb Ravi Sasi Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as one cannot see full image of Sun or Moon in unstable and wavy water.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau mlIn drpn mY n dyKIAiq inrml bdn srUp aurbs ko
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Maleen Darapan Mai N Daykheeati , Niramal Badan Saroop Urabas Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as one cannot see the complete beauty of the face of Urvashi the divine fairy in a dirty mirror.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy ibn dIp n smIp ko iblokIAqu Bvn BieAwn AMDkwr qRws qs ko
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Bin Deep N Sameep Ko Bilokeeatu , Bhavan Bhaiaan Andhakaar Traas Tas Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as without the light of a lamp, one cannot even see a thing lying close by. A house in darkness looks scary and frightening beside fear of intrusion of thieves.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy mwieAw Drm ADm ACwidE mnu siqgur iDAwn suK nwn pRym rs ko ]496]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Maaiaa Dharam Adham Achhaadiao Manu , Satigur Dhiaan Soukh Naan Praym Ras Ko ?496?

Shabad OS B.translation: So is the mind entangled in the darkness of mammon (maya). An ignorant mind cannot enjoy the unique bliss of the contemplation of True Guru and meditation on Lord's name.  (496)
